channel.title: math.GR updates on arXiv.org
channel.description: math.GR updates on the arXiv.org e-print archive.

item.title: Set-stabilizers in solvable permutation groups
item.description: arXiv:2412.17976v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Let G be a finite solvable permutation group. Then modulo a possibly trivial normal elementary abelian 3-subgroup, some set-stabilizer in G is a 2-group.
item.dc:creator: David Gluck

item.title: Finite groups whose subgroup graph contains a vertex of large degree
item.description: arXiv:2412.18087v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: T.C. Burness and S.D. Scott \cite{3} classified finite groups $G$ such that the number of prime order subgroups of $G$ is greater than $|G|/2-1$. In this note, we study finite groups $G$ whose subgroup graph contains a vertex of degree greater than $|G|/2-1$. The classification given for finite solvable groups extends the work of Burness and Scott.
item.dc:creator: Marius T\u{a}rn\u{a}uceanu

item.title: Infinite graph product of groups II: Analytic properties
item.description: arXiv:2412.18313v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We study analytic properties of graph product of finite groups with a hyperbolic defining graph. This is done by studying dynamics on the Bowditch compactification of the extension graph, or the crossing graph, of graph product. In particular, we provide a new class of convergence groups and identify the if and only if condition for this convergence action to be geometrically finite. We also provide a new class of properly proximal groups, relatively bi-exact groups, and groups with strongly solid group von Neumann algebras.
item.dc:creator: Koichi Oyakawa

item.title: Limits of harmonic functions on $\mathbb{Z}^d$
item.description: arXiv:2412.18465v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We give an example of a sequence of positive harmonic functions on $\mathbb{Z}^d$, $d\geq 2$, that converges pointwise to a non-harmonic function.
item.dc:creator: Ferdinand Jacob\'e de Naurois

item.title: Qusimorphisms on the group of density preserving diffeomorphisms of the M\"{o}bius band
item.description: arXiv:2412.18466v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: The existence of quasimorphisms on groups of homeomorphisms of manifolds has been extensively studied under various regularity conditions, such as smooth, volume-preserving, and symplectic. However, in this context, nothing is known about groups of `area'-preserving diffeomorphisms on non-orientable manifolds. In this paper, we initiate the study of groups of density-preserving diffeomorphisms on non-orientable manifolds. Here, the density is a natural concept that generalizes volume without concerning orientability. We show that the group of density-preserving diffeomorphisms on the M\"obius band admits countably many unbounded quasimorphisms which are linearly independent. Along the proof, we show that groups of density preserving diffeomorphisms on compact, connected, non-orientable surfaces with non-empty boundary are weakly contractible.
item.dc:creator: KyeongRo Kim, Shuhei Maruyama
